name: General Knowledge 1 Quiz | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: Who would use a metronome?
questions.explanation:
Musician.

	It has an upside-down pendulum that swings back and forth in regular time to aid a musician to keep the right tempo.

questions.text: What colour lies between red and yellow in the visible spectrum?
questions.explanation:
Orange.

	Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet. A common memory aid (mnemonic)is 'Richard Of York Gained Battles In Vain'.

questions.text: What is a young swan called?
questions.explanation: Cygnet.

questions.text: What sort of scan builds up a three-dimensional 'map' of a patient's body as the X-rays pass through their body using a circular scanning machine?
questions.explanation:
C.A.T. Scan

	The acronym C.A.T. stands for 'Computerized Axial Tomography'.

questions.text: Dr. Crippen murdered his wife and tried to escape to Canada with his mistress in 1910. What was Crippen's first name?
questions.explanation: Hawley.

questions.text: Which of the following isn't a desert plant?
questions.explanation:
Baobab tree.

	The Baobab tree comes from tropical Africa.

questions.text: Which ocean was formerly known as El Mar de Sur?
questions.explanation:
Pacific.

	Ferdinand Magellan renamed its calm waters 'The Pacific'.

questions.text: A movie is a long strip of thousands of still photographs projected so fast that they appear to the eye to make moving pictures. How many frames are used a second to make this animation?
Which sign of the zodiac is the only one that doesn't feature a creature or person?
questions.explanation: Libra.

questions.text: How many of the following were Scottish inventors: David Brewster (kaleidoscope), James Watt (condensing steam engine), Charles Macintosh (waterproof macintosh) and John Logie Baird (television)?
questions.explanation:
All were.

	Long cold nights in Scotland.  Not much else to do!

questions.text: Who wrote 'Beau Geste'?
questions.explanation:
P. C. Wren

	Percival Christopher Wren in 1924.

questions.text: How long would an astronaut's footprints last for on the moon?
questions.explanation:
Longer than a month.

	The Moon has no atmosphere so there is no wind or weather either so in theory the footprints should last for centuries.

questions.text: Name the author of 'The Prince and the Pauper'.
questions.explanation: Mark Twain.

questions.text: Where did Napoleon Bonaparte die?
questions.explanation: St Helena.

questions.text: Which is the sixth letter in the Greek Alphabet: alpha, beta, gamma, delta, epsilon, ... ?
questions.explanation:
Zeta.

	Omega is the last letter.

questions.text: The volcano on the uninhabited island of Krakatoa, between Java and Sumatra, erupted in 1883 sending tidal waves to neighbouring islands. How many lives did this claim?
The first ever 'assembly line' of workers were used to build which car?
questions.explanation:
Tin Lizzie.

	Tin Lizzie was the nickname given to the Model T Ford.

questions.text: According to legend, which Greek hero killed the half-man and half-bull monster called the Minotaur?
questions.explanation: Theseus.

questions.text: The 'Jahre Viking' was the world's biggest ... ?
questions.explanation:
Ship.

	It was an enormous oil tanker called a supertanker which was over 1,500 feet long.

questions.text: In 1953 New Zealander Edmund Hillary, along with Nepalese Tenzing Norgay, climbed Everest. What nationality, in 1975, was the first woman to climb Everest?
questions.explanation:
Japanese.

	Junko Tabei of Japan.

questions.text: How did Polish-born scientist Marie Curie die?
questions.explanation:
Leukaemia.

	She died of leukemia caused by prolonged exposure to radiation.

questions.text: The first of its type was introduced in 1930 and called 'Baffle Ball'. What became an instant hit selling 50,000 of these?
questions.explanation: Pinball machine.

questions.text: Old Faithful, a geyser in Yellowstone National Park USA, has erupted roughly every ...  minutes for the last eighty years?
questions.explanation:
76.

	Yellowstone Park is a 'super volcano'; it does not look like a standard cone-shaped volcano, but it is still an active volcano.

questions.text: What motor powered Clive Sinclair's electrically powered three-wheel vehicle, the C5?
questions.explanation: Washing machine.

questions.text: Name the mechanical model of the solar system in which the planets can be moved at the correct relative velocities around the sun?
questions.explanation:
Orrery.

	Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
